properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 20 at 2:29AM PST until January 21 at 2:00PM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 4500 feet. Total snow
accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. Winds gusting to around 35 to
50 mph.

* WHERE...Western Siskiyou County. This includes elevations above
4500 feet, including high portions of Sawyers Bar Road near Etna
Summit and Highway 3 near Scott Mountain.

* WHEN...From 1 AM to 2 PM PST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Heavy
snow and gusty winds could bring down tree branches.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... Heaviest snow is expected late Monday
night through Tuesday morning.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
* Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions.

* If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets,
food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you.

* The safest place during a winter storm is indoors.

* A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is
likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective
action now.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 2 PM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 4500 FEET
